title: How to Make Internet Explorer Your Default Internet Browser

steps.title: Open the Start menu.
steps.content: Open the Start menu. To do so, either click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the ⊞ Win key.

steps.title: Click the settings gear.
steps.content: Click the settings gear. This icon is in the lower-left corner of the screen. Doing so will open the Settings window.

steps.title: Click System.
steps.content: Click System . It's in the top-right side of the Settings home page. If Settings opens to a subfolder, first click the Back button in the top-left corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Default apps.
steps.content: Click Default apps . It's a tab on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Scroll down and click the option beneath the "Web browser" heading.
steps.content: Scroll down and click the option beneath the "Web browser" heading. This will likely be Microsoft Edge, which resembles a white "e" on a dark-blue background.

steps.title: Click Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Click Internet Explorer . It's the light-blue "e" icon. Doing so will set Internet Explorer as your computer's default browser. If prompted, click Switch anyway to confirm your decision.

steps.title: Open Internet Explorer.
steps.content: Open Internet Explorer. This app resembles a blue "e" with a gold band around it.

steps.title: Click ⚙️.
steps.content: Click ⚙️. It's in the upper-right corner of the Internet Explorer window.

steps.title: Click Internet options.
steps.content: Click Internet options . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click the Programs tab.
steps.content: Click the Programs tab. It's at the top of the Internet Options window.

steps.title: Click Make default.
steps.content: Click Make default . It's near the top of the Internet Options window, beneath the "Default web browser" heading. If this button is greyed out, Internet Explorer is already your default browser.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This button is at the bottom of the Internet Options window. Internet Explorer is now your default browser. You may have to close and re-open Internet Explorer before these changes take full effect.
